content.raw: the function will ignore the empty values silently, which is a valid behavior, yes. My point was more about being able to catch problems in the response of `common::find_file();` calls. An empty value can be consider as a valid value from these functions? If so, all is fine. If it is never supposed to happen (we always expect a path), I see a benefit (early error detection) of checking here.
